title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: I have this board, no corrosion found, had a short on pp3v42, that is fixed now, but now ppbus_g3h is at 15.6v already changed Q7130 and U7100 no change...

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
Change again Q7130 and C7125.
Be sure to have good solders and traces.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: Changed Q7130 and C7125, traces are good, still getting 15.6v

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: R7120 beeps with L7130?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 66916, member: 682"]
R7120 beeps with L7130?
[/QUOTE]
no it doesn´t

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
Did you solder correct Q7130 in place?
Be sure all solders and traces are good there.
Check all resistors around U7100.

Please, do NOT quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
There was ONLY ONE question, no need to do that for your reply.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: I´ve checked all traces, all are good, resoldered q7130, now I´m getting 3,6v at pin 1 of f7140 without the fuse...

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
Post basic voltages for U7100; pins 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Check R/C networks from pins 5, 7, 8.
Post exact resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Keep F7140 removed for the moment.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
just measured diode mode on pin 1 and 2 of f7140 (red probe ground, black on pins)
PIN 1- .138
PIN 2- .175
Checked big coils and there is one that has the same value that PIN 2 has:  L7630, with red probe on ground .175, with black probe on ground .199
I don´t know what else to do to make PPBUS_G3H to come to life, please help!

EDIT: Got the PPBUS_G3H to work! it was pin 8 on Q7130 that wasn´t good. Now I have 8.60, but don´t want to put the fuse back yet. Is the L7630 value correct?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: Check resistance between L7630 and pin 2 of F7140.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: resistance between L7630 and pin 2 of F7140 = 0.2 ohms

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
As expected, Q7630 is shorted.
Change it and pray PCH is still alive.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: Changed Q7630, and still measuring .2ohms, checked L7630 to ground on ohm scale I get 230 ohms in diode mode red probe to ground I get .165 is that a short?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
Thre short is between PPBUS_G3H and L7630, not to ground.
Remove Q7630 and check if that short disappears.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: removed Q7630 and checked from L7630 to PIN 2 from F7140 im getting 3 Kohms and going up. Thanks for your patience, I know this is a delicate line and I don´t want to screw it up if it is not screwed yet...

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: Be sure to solder good and correctly Q7630.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: resoldered Q7630 and getting 4 kohms from L7630 to PIN 2 F7140, hopefully that is good and I can go ahead and put in the fuse?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
Looks good now, try it.
Be aware, shorted Q7630 could already affected PCH/CPU.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
So I put the fuse back, connected it to the PSU and nothing...  Q7630 shorted again...
Removed Q7630 and there is no short to ground on L7630. that is a good thing isn´t it?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
Check R7631 and R/C7630.
Change Q7630 and U7600 at same time.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
just to be sure, I removed L7630 and the short is on PIN 2 in diode mode PIN 1 is .248
it´s dead right?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: L7630 looks like this on the bottom, better change it?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: is there a way of protecting the cpu/pch when testing with the PSU? I´ve had now 2 of the same year and model which ended being PCH. It´s frustrating, because it was off, but I don´t know if maybe something I did kill it... Thanks for your comments...

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
You didn't have short to ground on L7630 before?
What is the exact ohm value of that short now?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: L7630 PIN 1 0.5 ohm, PIN 2 10 Kohm

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: You said short on pin 2 before...

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: sorry I missed that one... so is there anything to do? Hail Mary maybe?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: If short is on pin2/L7630 (as expected), PCH (CPU) has been killed because of shorted Q7630; overvoltage coming from PPBUS_G3H.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: Ok, to avoid this happening in other motherboards of this model, what can be done?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
That should not happen by itself.
You should protect the board against liquid spill and high humidity ambient.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message: I meant, while I am working on them to not kill them when I connect the charger, that could happen because of PPBUS_G3H was high?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS 15V
message:
Before connect charger, ALWAYS check diode mode to ground on all big coils.
You should interpret the readings correctly, to see if there is any short between PPBUS_G3H (L7130) and a secondary power supply derived from it.
